author: Special Correspondent
text:
The bhakti poet has a huge following in Punjab and Uttar Pradesh

The birth anniversary of medieval bhakti poet Sant Ravidas on Monday proved to be a fresh battleground for political parties vying for Dalit votes.

While Prime Minster Narendra Modi and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal paid obeisance at the Sant Ravidas Mandir in his birthplace Varanasi, where the two leaders contested the Lok Sabha polls in 2014, the Congress, the Bahujan Samaj Party and the Samajwadi Party also commemorated the saint’s jayanti with much fanfare.

The overtures are considered attempts to garner the Dalit vote in the Punjab and Uttar Pradesh elections. Sant Ravidas, who stood against institutionalised caste hierarchy, has a huge following among Dalits in Punjab and U.P.

Mr. Modi visited the Ravidas temple, where he also took part in a langar. He was soon followed by Mr. Kejriwal.

BSP chief Mayawati said on Mr. Modi’s visit: “it is only by following the teachings and actions of Sant Ravidas can someone become a better human being.”
title: Parties eye Dalit votes in Punjab, U.P., celebrate Ravidas jayanti
